metadata.title: CVE-2017-7561 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Red Hat JBoss EAP version 3.0.7 through before 4.0.0.Beta1 is vulnerable toa server-side cache poisoning or CORS requests in the JAX-RS componentresulting in a moderate impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7561` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libresteasy-java - 3.6.2-1
No subscription required

libresteasy3.0-java - 3.0.26-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: resteasy package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.2-1').
resteasy3.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.26-1').
